subject: Economics
title: Bretton Woods: 44 Nations, One Hotel, One System
description: A quick, practical guide to Bretton Woods: 44 Nations, One Hotel, One System.

hook.text: In 1944, 730 delegates from 44 countries met at a New Hampshire hotel to redesign the world's money system.

buildup.text: John Maynard Keynes proposed a global currency. America said no â€” the dollar would be the world's anchor.

discovery.text: Every currency was pegged to the dollar. The dollar was pegged to gold at $35/ounce. America became the world's banker.

twist.text: The system assumed America would be disciplined. Vietnam War spending and trade deficits proved otherwise.

climax.text: Bretton Woods created the dollar-dominated world we still live in â€” designed in three weeks at a resort hotel.

punchline.text: The global financial system was designed in a ski lodge.

quiz.question: What was the key feature of the Bretton Woods system?
options: A global currency for all nations
All currencies pegged to the dollar, which was pegged to gold
